snippet: The American military’s involvement in Niger illustrates how the Pentagon is trying to juggle two competing missions in Africa: contain the spread of Islamist militancy without having to pour a lot of soldiers or money into the region.
abstract: Pentagon is helping Niger and other African countries to combat rising Islamist militancy by providing advice and training African troops to deal with terrorists on their own; strategy represents marked shift from direct involvement in conflicts, as American defense budget shrinks and citizens lose appetite for intervening in foreign wars.
lead_paragraph: The American military’s involvement in Niger illustrates how the Pentagon is trying to juggle two competing missions in Africa: contain the spread of Islamist militancy without having to pour a lot of soldiers or money into the region.

headline.main: U.S. Takes Training Role in Africa as Threats Grow and Budgets Shrink
